content: You have removed the emailaccount via the accountsettings in thunderbird? and when you open thundebird it still ask to login in google? first of all try to remove the cookies via settings > privacy and security

content: My best guess is there is still an address book linked to Google Contacts, or a Google Calendar, or both. Check your settings.
creator: christ1

content: You must install an add-on. Under the Tools menu or in settings.
creator: mozilla98

content:
Get the add-on from here: https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/importexporttools-ng/

Also see https://support.mozilla.org/kb/installing-addon-thunderbird for more information about how to install add-ons.
creator: christ1

content: You need to check if the settings of your smtp server in thunderbird is still correct. right click on your accountname in Thunderbird, select settings , Edit SMTP serverâ€¦ , then get a window with your settings, check if this is the same as your provider announced on there support site .
creator: Mad_Maks

content:
Do you mean "winmail.dat"? If so, the following add-on might be helpful: LookOut (fix version) https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/addon/lookout-fix-version/

Quotation from the above link:

LookOut decodes winmail.dat (TNEF encoded) files that may come from a misconfigured Microsoft Exchange server or Outlook user allowing access to the original attachments.
creator: Yu5tiqX9og

content: Sorry I was looking at FireFox instead of Gmail settings lol Now it worked! Please ignore my question above lol
creator: fareastsoulmusic

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content:
Translation: "Hello, I already have 2 email accounts on Thunderbird: xxxx@xxxx.fr and xxxx@xxxx.fr. I want to add a third one: xxx@xxxx.fr.When I go to account settings --> "+ New account" --> Full name + email address --> "Configure"After that, the process does not complete: a loading circle goes on endlessly without ever moving to the next step.Have a good day,"

Hello, I think the problem may be the new experimental setup wizard. - click to settings>general and UNTICK the experimental setup wizard and retry setting up the account. see attached.
creator: davidsk

content: Did you delete your POP account in Thunderbird?
creator: mozilla98

content: - install the importexporttools NG addon - highlight Local Folders - Rightclick and select importexport option to import mbox - navigate to old profile, select the Mail folder and then the POP account folder - select any file, such as Sent, Inbox, but ignore the msf entries - next, repeat the import process and select the Mail\Local Folders folder and select desired files, again ignoring msf entiries - finally, click tools>import>import from a file and follow menus to addressbook and to sqlite file option - select the abook.sqlite file from old profile - repeat the import process for history.sqlite file - if your old thunderbird was older than release 78, the above two steps may not have retrieved addresses. in that case, repeat the tools>import process but this time, click the Mork Structure instead of the Sqlite structure and select first the abook.mab file and repeat to select the history.mab
creator: davidsk
